senses.ex: She always bears a smile on her face.

Tips.title: Emotional Bearing
Tips.description: Using 'bear' to convey supportive or positive actions, often emotionally charged.
Tips.example: He bore her sorrows with great care.

Tips.title: Physical Objects
Tips.description: 'Bear' can refer to physically carrying items, not just abstract concepts.
Tips.example: She bore the basket on her head.

senses.ex: He could not bear the pain anymore.

Tips.title: Negative Endurance
Tips.description: Often used to express endurance of negative experiences or feelings.
Tips.example: I can barely bear the cold winters here.

senses.ex: I saw a bear in the forest.

Tips.title: Physical Representation
Tips.description: It implies having a visible mark or characteristic that is notable or significant.
Tips.example: The ancient coin bore the king's insignia.

Tips.title: Family Resemblance
Tips.description: Often used when discussing similarities in appearance or behavior between relatives.
Tips.example: She bears a strong resemblance to her grandmother.

senses.de: To have as a characteristic or feature

Tips.title: Evidence and Proof
Tips.description: Can imply providing evidence for something or witnessing an event.
Tips.example: This document bears evidence of his involvement.

senses.de: To produce or yield especially by natural growth
senses.ex: The tree bears fruit every summer.

Tips.title: Natural Processes
Tips.description: Often used to describe natural processes, referring to plants or trees producing fruit.
Tips.example: Our garden bears tomatoes and cucumbers every year.

senses.ex: He bears the responsibility for the accident.

Tips.title: Moral Accountability
Tips.description: Implies moral or ethical responsibility for actions or decisions.
Tips.example: The CEO bears the blame for the company's failure.

senses.de: Person who sells shares hoping price will fall
senses.ex: He's a bear when it comes to the stock market.

Tips.title: Investment Trends
Tips.description: Used in finance to describe a negative outlook or a decline in the market.
Tips.example: Investors fear we're entering a bear market.

Tips.title: Strategic Pessimism
Tips.description: Can refer to someone who strategically expects lower prices to profit.
Tips.example: Bob's a bear; he profits when stocks fall.

Abide.wordDefinition:
Abide means to accept, follow or obey something, to stay or live somewhere, or to tolerate something or someone.

For example: "I will abide by the rules of the game" or "I can't abide the noise in this city anymore."

Abide is used when we talk about following rules or living in a place, while bear is used when we talk about enduring difficulties or carrying weights.

Carry.wordDefinition:
Carry means to transport or hold something while moving from one place to another. For example, "I can carry the load of books from the library to my home.".

Bear implies more physical strain and endurance, while carry implies more movement from place to place.

Confront.wordDefinition:
Confront means to face a problem directly and try to solve it. For instance, if you have a problem with someone, you confront them by talking to them and trying to find a solution.

Bear means to tolerate, while confront means to face and solve a problem.

Endure.wordDefinition:
It can also mean to tolerate or endure a difficult or unpleasant situation. For example, "I can't bear the thought of losing you" means I can't handle the idea of losing you.

Endure means to suffer or experience something difficult for a long time without giving up. For example, "I endured a lot of pain during my recovery from surgery" means I suffered through a lot of pain during my recovery.

Bear is typically used to describe carrying a burden or tolerating a difficult situation, while endure describes suffering through something for a long time without giving up.

Support.wordDefinition:
Support means to help something or someone by providing assistance, encouragement or backing. For example, you may support a friend who is going through a tough time or support a political candidate you believe in.

Bear is about carrying something while support is about helping something.

Sustain.wordDefinition:
Sustain means to support or keep something going. For example, a company can sustain its growth by continuing to innovate, or a person can sustain their health by eating a balanced diet and exercising regularly.

Bear is applicable when referring to enduring or tolerating something, while sustain is applicable when referring to supporting or maintaining something.

Tolerate.wordDefinition:
Tolerate means to allow or permit something to happen or exist without interference. It means putting up with something or someone you may not agree with.

For example: "I tolerate my little brother's messy room."

Bear is more focused on enduring something difficult, while tolerate is about accepting something you may not necessarily like.

Withstand.wordDefinition:
Withstand means to resist, oppose, or endure something that is harmful or challenging. For example, if a building can withstand an earthquake, it means it is strong enough to resist the shaking and not collapse.

Bear is more about enduring something that is uncomfortable or unpleasant, while withstand is about resisting something that is potentially harmful or dangerous.

videos.Text: Whether it's an anxiety-filled night of being chased through the woods by a bear or fighting off a ninja in a dark alley, these dreams allow you to practice your fight or flight instincts and keep them sharp and dependable in case you'll need them in real life. But it doesn't always have to be unpleasant.

quotes.Text: The soldier above all others prays for peace, for it is the soldier who must suffer and bear the deepest wounds and scars of war.
quotes.Title: American General
quotes.Name: Douglas MacArthur

quotes.Text: Is life not a thousand times too short for us to bore ourselves?
quotes.Title: German Philosopher
quotes.Name: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.Text: The most important thing is that you don't bore the audience.
quotes.Title: Actress
quotes.Name: Jacqueline Fernandez

quotes.Text: Even in my personal life, I can't bear to have bad feelings.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Akshaye Khanna

quotes.Text: I cannot bear the responsibility for one drop of blood.
quotes.Title: Egyptian Scientist
quotes.Name: Mohamed ElBaradei

quotes.Text: I hope I didn't bore you too much with my life story.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Elvis Presley

quotes.Text: I'm a bore. I save all my energy for my characters.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Joe Pesci

quotes.Text: I write in order to bear witness to life.
quotes.Title: German Novelist
quotes.Name: Herta Muller

quotes.Text: Without courage, wisdom bears no fruit.
quotes.Title: Spanish Philosopher
quotes.Name: Baltasar Gracian
